CatDescriptText: "Ed" Weinmann, U.S. Airman, Soho and Floyd Skiles, dental technician, Fifth Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 20, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe in the old-fashioned "woodshed" reprimand or the "talking things over with the offender" type of discipline as regards the correction of youngsters guilty of misdemeanors?" Mr. Weinmann's answer reads: "It is better to talk it over.  A talk hurts more than a beating."  Mr. Skiles' answer reads: "Personally, I think the old woodshed method is the best... and the law prohibiting beating by parents should be amended.  However the parent should not go to extremes."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of "Ed" Weinmann wearing cross hatch patterned overcoat with upturned collar, standing in front of KQV radio station,Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Floyd Skiles wearing eyeglasses, zippered jacket, and hat with 1959 Pennsylvania fishing license in band, standing in front of KQV radio station, Smithfield Street, Downtown
